pLaunchControl

Class Knob

  • java.lang.Object
    • pLaunchControl.Knob

  • public class Knob
extends java.lang.Object
    A logical representation of the physical knob in the MIDI controller. The most trivial usage of a Knob is to adjust the value of a variable in your code, using variable method. A Knob object can be assigned a default value, as well as a range

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      KNOBS controllerKnob 
      protected java.lang.String variable
      The name of the variable to set when knob changes

    • Method Detail

      • defaultValue

        public Knob defaultValue(float defaultValue)
        Sets the default value of the Knob object. You can read the current value of the Knob with value().
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - The default value to assign Knob object. Remember that calling defaultValue() does not change the position of the physical knob, but it's useful to set a initial value to the attached variable.
        Returns:
        The Knob itself.

      • minValue

        public Knob minValue(float minValue)
        Sets the value to be returned when the knob is at its minimum position (0 by default). range(float,float)
        Parameters:
        minValue - The value of the Knob object when the knob button is at its leftmost position (default 0).
        Returns:
        The Knob itself.

      • maxValue

        public Knob maxValue(float maxValue)
        Sets the value to be returned when the knob is at its maximum position (127 by default). range(float,float)
        Parameters:
        maxValue - The value of the Knob object when the knob button is at its rightmost position (default 128).
        Returns:
        The Knob itself.

      • range

        public Knob range(float minValue,
                  float maxValue)
        Sets the minimum and maximum values to return when knobs is at its minimum and maximum position, respectively. You can use range() instead of calling minValue(float) and maxValue(float)
        Parameters:
        minValue - The value of the Knob object when the knob button is at its leftmost position (default 0).
        maxValue - The value of the Knob object when the knob button is at its rightmost position (default 127).
        Returns:
        The Knob itself.

      • value

        public float value()
        Returns:
        The current value of the knob object, according to its defined range. Note that value() might not be equivalent to the knob position at all times, because it is not possible to either set the physical position of the Knob, or to read its current position - you need to manually update the knob position for value to be updated in the logical Knob object.

      • variable

        public Knob variable(java.lang.String variable)
        Attachs the knob value to a variable. The variable name must match a float variable in your sketch. Currently
        Parameters:
        variable -
        Returns:
